abstract: The world’s largest chip maker is holding itself up as a model for others to follow by increasing capital spending during a deep economic slump.
snippet: The world’s largest chip maker is holding itself up as a model for others to follow by increasing capital spending during a deep economic slump.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Paul S. Otellini, the chief executive of Intel, made an uncharacteristic lunge toward the limelight on Tuesday, holding up his company’s $7 billion investment in new computer chip factories as a patriotic gesture for other businesses to follow.

headline.main: Intel’s Chief Calls for Investments in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Intel’s Chief Calls for Investments in U.S.
